Posts.Content: MRI's are expensive and since there is no sign of cancer on the mammogram or ultrasound, the insurance company will not approve it. They don't typically allow them for diagnostics. Even my sister, a BC survivor, has to fight to get hers done every year. I had no problem whatsoever with the compression mammo, ultrasound or biopsies. As I said in an earlier post, if they ask me to go again this year, I'll fight for it.
Posts.Title: Someone, please help me... horrified to go back for spot compression and ultrasound 1 2

Posts.Content: It's difficult to not have this consume you until you get your results back. I have 5 biopsies done at once and everything came back negative. I've had what you had. The oval shaped things were cysts. The complex lesions were complex cysts (cysts with debris in them). I also have microcalcifications which they haven't done anything with yet, granduloma. Heck, my boobs look like a bubble gum machine on an ultrasound! They used to make me go every 6 months, now I go every year. Last year they wanted me to go for an MRI, because my breasts are very dense. I didn't do it because I figured the insurance company wouldn't pay for it and I didn't want to get angry, so I let it go. I'm going to a new radiologist this year. If they want an MRI, I'll fight with the insurance company. My mother died from BC at 82, and my sister (survivor!) was diagnosed at 46, my cousin (survivor!) at 41. I am 48. I decided about the last round of biopsy's that this is not going to hang over me like a lead weight just waiting to pounce. My sister tested negataive for the BRCA. Best of luck to you and try not to worry
Posts.Title: Someone, please help me... horrified to go back for spot compression and ultrasound 1 2

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by uptownJ I would highly recommend getting an MRI. It can show things no mammogram or ultrasound has the ability to show. I get one every year. I have to pay for it but it is at a reduced rate and they let me pay it off a little at a time. It is truly the gold-standard of diagnostics and it showed my breast cancer like no other machine! If I would have demanded an MRI earlier, my breast cancer would have been diagnosed at a much smaller less advanced stage. PLEASE follow through with the MRI. Often times, it can show if cancer has moved into lymph nodes. My husband and I are far from rich and we have lousy insurance but this is my life.... get the MRI. Sharon Unfortunately, if the insurance doesn't pay for it, I will not be able to have it done. I'm a divorced mom with two kids and no child support. LOL! I guess I could always provide my ex-husbands ss#. If anything comes up cancer, I'll opt for a double masectomy and be done with it. Better than worrying once a year.
Posts.Title: Someone, please help me... horrified to go back for spot compression and ultrasound 1 2

Posts.Content: Just had biopsy today. Doc said it looks good but have to wait for cytology. Go to the doc. It's so worth the peace of mind. BC took my Mother's life, I won't let it take mine!
Posts.Title: Please help me understand an ultrasound report

Posts.Content: I also have dense breasts and cysts, making mammograms difficult to read. The ultrasound shows my cysts as hypoechoic as well. I was told these were complex cysts, meaning there is debris and not just fluid in them. I have lots of them in both breasts. I also have simple cysts (fluid only). I've had them aspirated and they just come back. They are painful, but benign. I was told I had fibrocystic breasts.
Posts.Title: Please help me understand an ultrasound report

Posts.Content: Diagnosed years ago with many cysts. I've had six biopsies, all came back fine. These cysts were always painful, but recently over the top painful. It's just one breast, but man it hurts bad 24/7. Advil doesn't help. Any suggestions for pain relief? I was supposed to go for a 6-month mammo and ultrasound but lost my insurance, so that didn't happen. So tired if these. Wish they'd just go away.
Posts.Title: Super painful cysts

Posts.Content: Feels the same, painful as Hades. I've had them aspirated but they fill up in a month. I have both simple and complex in both breasts, but one side is very painful. Mammos are torture.
Posts.Title: Super painful cysts
